alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:09PM EST until January 12 at 6:16PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Oglethorpe Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Ward Road floods and cuts off access to L.C. Curtis and Son Sand and Gravel Company. Irrigation systems also begin to flood and need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM EST Tuesday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.8 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 05/21/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
